article.headline: Vermont 77, UMBC 65
article.story: BALTIMORE -- Colin McIntosh and Mike Trimboli scored 15 points apiece to help Vermont defeat Maryland-Baltimore County 77-65 on Tuesday night. The Catamounts (21-7, 12-3 America East Conference) have won 12 of their last 13 games and snapped UMBC's three-game winning streak. The Retrievers (12-14, 6-8) led 37-30 at halftime and scored the first basket of the second half. The Catamounts responded with an 11-0 run, then built a 55-46 lead. UMBC cut the deficit to three, but Vermont used an 8-0 spurt to pull away. The Catamounts made 31 of 55 field goals (56.4 percent) while the Retrievers were 25 of 62 (40.3 percent). Marqus Blakely and Maurice Joseph added 13 points apiece for Vermont and Joey Accaoui had 12. Darryl Proctor had 24 points and 10 rebounds for UMBC, which took a 37-29 rebounding edge. Chauncey Gilliam added 16 points and 10 boards.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
